credentials: PHD 2015 New School for General Studies
name: LAUREN SCHMITZ

ratings.comment: Dr. Schmitz is clearly passionate about her work and equitable policy implementations. Expectations are clear and she is eager to help and offer feedback. The material can be difficult but she makes sure to build fundamental concepts and is very receptive of questions. She is a wonderful professor!

The course was fine overall. Professor Schmitz sometimes struggled to explain concepts to those without the same level of background knowledge, which could be frustrating. However, as long as you can write a solid paper, you should do well in the class.

Professor Schmitz is a very kind person and is great at teaching. The course content was challenging at times, but she would reassure us that we were not "behind" for not understanding it. The class was interesting, but I would not recommend taking it unless you need it for your major/certificate. I think it just was a little too much work.

Professor Schmitz is clearly very passionate about the topics she is presenting. You definitely need to attend at least 80% of the lectures to clearly grasp what the class is about, especially when it comes time to write the final paper. She assigns barely any homework, which means you must do well on every assignment. Overall great professor!
